actions.args: {"body": {"name": "### Summary of Work Activities: Hackbox Product Manager (Aug 20 - Sept 20, 2024)", "summary": "A summary of all completed work activities between the specified date range, and all planned work for the next pay period.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "- Attended weekly syncs with Events and Data teams\\\\n- Maintained [REDACTED] hackathon [Devpost](https://redacted.devpost.com/) pages and all related elements, updating Judges, ecosystem bounties, FAQs, technical resources, according to daily developments.\\\\n- Produced and delivered three issues of the [REDACTED Digest](https://redacted.devpost.com/updates), a weekly newsletter for hackathon registrants.\\\\n- Coordinated with ecosystem teams on [REDACTED] bounty details \\\\n- Designed and administered intake flow for [REDACTED] City Node hosts in Toronto, Mexico, Nigeria, San Francisco, and London.\\\\n- Coordinated with key stakeholders from NF, DevHub, Events Committee, and NEAR Horizon on all [REDACTED] hackathon-related activities.\\\\n- Reviewed and provided feedback on proposals in the Events Committee pipeline.\\\\n- Coordinate bounty payout and post-event report delivery from the PitchTalk team for the [HOT App Hackathon](https://pitchtalk.com/en/events/Hot-App-Hackathon)\\\\n- Explore and develop Hackbox website features with Sasha Pais\\\\n\\\\n#### Timeline\\\\nStart: August 20 2024\\\\nEnd date: September 20 2024\\\\nTotal hours per week: 45\\\\nTotal hours: 180\\\\nHourly rate: $50/hr\\\\nTotal: $9000", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "discoballer.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "9000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Hackbox", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 128228581}

{"body": {"name": "[REDACTED] NEAR Toronto-Waterloo City Node | #PoweredByHackbox", "summary": "This initiative aims to establish a NEAR Toronto-Waterloo City Node for builders participating in workshops and the upcoming [REDACTED] Hackathon, building on the success of the Hawkhacks hackathon. The focus will be on fostering innovation through workshops, mentorship, and hands-on activities, culminating in a global hackathon finale.\\\\n", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# [REDACTED] NEAR Toronto-Waterloo City Node | #PoweredByHackbox\\\\n\\\\n**Requested amount**: $15,000\\\\n\\\\n## 1. City Node Overview\\\\n\\\\n- **Title**: [REDACTED] NEAR Toronto-Waterloo City Node  \\\\n- **Date & Format**: September 26 - October 25th, 2024  \\\\n- **Location**: Waterloo, Canada  \\\\n\\\\nThis initiative aims to establish a NEAR Toronto-Waterloo City Node for builders participating in workshops and the upcoming [REDACTED] Hackathon, building on the success of the Hawkhacks hackathon. The focus will be on fostering innovation through workshops, mentorship, and hands-on activities, culminating in a global hackathon finale. This brief outlines next steps, including budget identification and integrating workshops that emphasize chain signatures, AI, and a chain-agnostic approach.\\\\n\\\\n## 2. Organizing Team\\\\n\\\\n- **Lead Organizer**: Sal Chaudhry (& NEAR Toronto Team)  \\\\n- **Partnerships**:  \\\\n  - Konfer (Hawkhacks Student Leadership Team)  \\\\n  - University of Waterloo Student Groups  \\\\n  - Wilfrid Laurier University Student Groups  \\\\n\\\\n## 3. Event Objectives\\\\n\\\\n- Foster innovation through workshops, mentorship, and hands-on activities, culminating in a global hackathon finale in Bangkok.\\\\n- Engage the local community in Canada\\\\u{2019}s premier tech hub by creating a Waterloo City Node, contributing as a satellite station for the global hackathon.\\\\n- Identify budget and allocate resources for all phases.\\\\n- Integrate chain signatures, AI, and a chain-agnostic approach into workshops.\\\\n- Provide participants access to industry experts, tools, and platforms.\\\\n- Develop a clear roadmap for scaling successful projects post-hackathon, including funding and partnership opportunities.\\\\n- Encourage collaboration across ecosystems for widespread adoption and long-term success.\\\\n\\\\n## 4. Challenges & Themes\\\\n\\\\n- **Chain-Agnostic Development**:  \\\\n  Create solutions for cross-compatibility with various blockchain ecosystems, fostering interoperability.\\\\n  \\\\n- **AI Integration**:  \\\\n  Explore innovative use cases at the intersection of artificial intelligence and blockchain technology.\\\\n\\\\n- **Chain Signature Workshops**:  \\\\n  Enhance security and authentication through workshops focused on chain signatures and secure coding practices.\\\\n\\\\n- **Collaboration and Innovation**:  \\\\n  Encourage cross-sector and cross-regional collaboration to drive creative problem-solving and cutting-edge solutions.\\\\n\\\\n- **Hackathon Preparation**:  \\\\n  Support participants of varying skill and experience levels.\\\\n\\\\n- **Incentivize Completion**:  \\\\n  Implement incentives for program completion and participant retention.\\\\n\\\\n- **Community Growth and Leadership**:  \\\\n  Foster the continued growth of the community built during the Hawkhacks Hackathon in 2024 and invest in NEAR as a supporter of young developers in blockchain and AI technology.\\\\n\\\\n## 5. Schedule and Activities\\\\n\\\\n- **Duration**: 6 weeks  \\\\n- **Key Activities**:  \\\\n  - **Kick-off Meet-Up**: Introduction to hackathon themes, project expectations, and timeline.  \\\\n  - **4 Workshops**:  \\\\n    - Weekly technical workshops on NEAR, AI, chain signatures, and blockchain development.\\\\n    - Guided sessions for participants to develop their projects.  \\\\n  - **Mentorship Access**: Dedicated mentorship throughout the program.  \\\\n  - **Pitch & Presentation**: Sessions to refine project submissions and pitches.  \\\\n  - **Closing Showcase Event**:  \\\\n    - Connect participants with mentors and peers.  \\\\n    - Showcase participant projects.  \\\\n    - Identify pathways for project continuation and highlight post-hackathon resources.\\\\n\\\\n- **Other Considerations**:  \\\\n  - **Gamification Elements**: Incorporate week-to-week leaderboard activities, earning bounties, and staggered prizing to maintain enthusiasm.  \\\\n  - **Sponsorships**: Seek external funding and stipends to support participants and attract diverse talent.\\\\n\\\\n### Tentative Dates\\\\n\\\\n- **Overall Timeline**: September 26th, 2024 - November 1st, 2024  \\\\n- **September 26th**: Kick-off Event  \\\\n- **October 2nd**: Workshop #1  \\\\n- **October 10th**: Workshop #2  \\\\n- **October 17th**: Workshop #3  \\\\n- **October 24th**: Workshop #4  \\\\n- **On-Going**: Mentorship Access  \\\\n- **October 25th**: Showcase/Closing Event  \\\\n\\\\n## 6. KPIs and Impact\\\\n\\\\n- **Key Performance Indicators**:\\\\n  - **# of Registrants**: Target: 100+  \\\\n  - **# of Teams**: Target: 18+  \\\\n  - **Weekly Workshop Attendance**: Target: 35+  \\\\n  - **Participant Completion**: Target: 40+  \\\\n  - **Quality Submissions**: Target: 13+  \\\\n  - **[REDACTED] Hackathon Submissions**: Target: 13+  \\\\n\\\\n## 7. Budget and Funding\\\\n\\\\n- **Proposed Budget**: [View Budget Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WT7X2x2CyG8nt5pNQi5OlazlL1eRcnVg_uJJ4QH0rz4/edit?usp=sharing)\\\\n\\\\n## 8. Bounties and Prizes\\\\n\\\\nIn addition to the bounties and prizes from the [REDACTED] Hackathon, we aim to offer additional City Node-specific incentives to drive weekly retention, submissions, and overall participation. A blend of cash bounties and prize packs will be used.\\\\n\\\\n## 9. Evaluation Criteria\\\\n\\\\n- **Program Completion**: Assessed by participant activity, attendance, and involvement.\\\\n- **Project Evaluation**: Based on criteria from the [REDACTED] Hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n## 10. Marketing and Promotion\\\\n\\\\nIn addition to NEAR Toronto\\\\u{2019}s own marketing channels, we will leverage partnerships with the University of Waterloo and Wilfrid Laurier University to promote Hawkhacks 2024. A multi-channel approach will include:\\\\n\\\\n- Hawkhacks 2024 mailing list  \\\\n- NEAR Toronto mailing list  \\\\n- Marketing through student groups  \\\\n- Incentivized attendance with rewards  \\\\n- Social media campaigns  \\\\n- Posters and on-campus promotions  \\\\n\\\\n## 11. Contact Information\\\\n\\\\n- **Email**: neartorontohub@gmail.com  \\\\n- **Phone**: 1-647-278-1385  \\\\n- **Telegram Handle**: @salshuttlesworth  ", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "toronto-sc.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "15000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Hackbox"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 128350469}
